Authors:
Janith Vishvakeerthi Aluthmuhandiram, Dhanushka Nadeeshan
Wanasinghe, Thilini Chethana, Yusufjon Gafforov, Natsaran Saichana,
Kevin D. Hyde, Xinghong Li, JiYe Yan
Title:
Lophiostomataceae (Dothideomycetes): Lophiostoma
khanzada-kirgizbaeva sp. nov. and Paucispora xishanensis sp. nov.
Keywords: New species, China, phylogeny, taxonomy, Uzbekistan
Abstract:
Lophiostoma khanzada-kirgizbaeva sp. nov. isolated from
dead woody branch in Uzbekistan and Paucispora xishanensis sp. nov.
isolated from dead woody branch in China, are described and illustrated
in this study. Lophiostoma khanzada-kirgizbaeva is characterized by 13
septate, initially fusiform, hyaline ascospores, which turn ellipsoidal
and dark brown at maturity. Paucispora xishanensis is characterized by
depressed conical-shaped ascomata and initially hyaline ascospores which
turn dark brown at maturity. Maximum likelihood and Bayesian inference
analyses of a combined SSU, ITS, LSU, tef1-α and rpb2 sequence matrix
show that Lophiostoma khanzada-kirgizbaev and Paucispora xishanensis are
distinct from other Lophiostoma and Paucispora species respectively in
Lophiostomataceae.
